checks.label: Duplicate payment verification
checks.detail: 105 high-confidence groups (£406.0K). Duplicate ratio: 0.6%. Filtered out: 20 batch payments, 1174 CSV overlaps.

checks.label: Split payment analysis
checks.detail: 4 suspect instances (£368.9K, 0.2% of spend). Threshold: 5+ payments to same supplier in same week, 80%+ of approval limit.

checks.label: Year-end spike verification
checks.detail: Highest spike: 4.9x in Capital. Year-end spikes are common in public sector (capital programmes, grants). Only extreme spikes (>3x) warrant concern.

checks.label: CH compliance — pre-breach only
checks.detail: 12 suppliers have current breaches, but all payments were made before breaches started. Not violations at time of payment.

checks.label: Cross-council price comparison
checks.detail: 15 shared suppliers found. 1 with >200% price gap (requiring 3+ transactions each side). Extreme disparities (>10,000%) filtered as different service scopes.

checks.label: Benford's Law forensic screening
checks.detail: Significant deviation from Benford's Law (p < 0.001). χ²=468.04 on 16718 amounts >£100. Largest deviation: digit 5 (4.0% off expected).

warnings: 1 suppliers show >200% price disparity after filtering. These are more likely genuine value concerns than extreme outliers.

Benford's Law analysis shows significant deviation (χ²=468.04). Digit 5 deviates 4.0% from expected. This warrants investigation but can also occur with legitimate round-number grants or threshold-based payments.
